1577487392_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body:
I'm gonna be the dissenting voice here and say elementary's the better choice - it's based on ubuntu, so the setup is super easy, you get to take advantage of ubuntu's huge catalog of software and, due to how popular ubuntu is, there are a lot of resources to help you with nearly any problem you can concievably have.
Honestly, if you need to ask - chances are you'll be better off with elementary, or any other ubuntu-based distro.
